verses.verse: So these<WH428> three<WH7969> men<WH376> ceased<WH7673> to answer<WH4480> <WH6030> <WH853> Job,<WH347> because<WH3588> he<WH1931> was righteous<WH6662> in his own eyes.<WH5869>

Then was kindled<WH2734> the wrath<WH639> of Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite,<WH940> of the kindred<WH4480> <WH4940> of Ram:<WH7410> against Job<WH347> was his wrath<WH639> kindled,<WH2734> because<WH5921> he justified<WH6663> himself<WH5315> rather than God.<WH4480> <WH430>

Also against his three<WH7969> friends<WH7453> was his wrath<WH639> kindled,<WH2734> because<WH5921> <WH834> they had found<WH4672> no<WH3808> answer,<WH4617> and yet had condemned<WH7561> <WH853> Job.<WH347>
Now Elihu<WH453> had waited<WH2442> till<WH853> Job<WH347> had spoken,<WH1697> because<WH3588> they<WH1992> were elder<WH2205> <WH3117> than<WH4480> he.
When Elihu<WH453> saw<WH7200> that<WH3588> there was no<WH369> answer<WH4617> in the mouth<WH6310> of these three<WH7969> men,<WH376> then his wrath<WH639> was kindled.<WH2734>

And Elihu<WH453> the son<WH1121> of Barachel<WH1292> the Buzite<WH940> answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> I<WH589> am young,<WH6810> and ye<WH859> are very old;<WH3453> <WH3117> wherefore<WH5921> <WH3651> I was afraid,<WH2119> and durst<WH3372> not show<WH4480> <WH2331> you mine opinion.<WH1843>
I said,<WH559> Days<WH3117> should speak,<WH1696> and multitude<WH7230> of years<WH8141> should teach<WH3045> wisdom.<WH2451>
But <WH403> there is a spirit<WH7307> in man:<WH582> and the inspiration<WH5397> of the Almighty<WH7706> giveth them understanding.<WH995>
Great <WH7227> men are not<WH3808> always wise:<WH2449> neither do the aged<WH2205> understand<WH995> judgment.<WH4941>
Therefore <WH3651> I said,<WH559> Hearken<WH8085> to me; I<WH589> also<WH637> will show<WH2331> mine opinion.<WH1843>
Behold, <WH2005> I waited<WH3176> for your words;<WH1697> I gave ear<WH238> to<WH5704> your reasons,<WH8394> whilst<WH5704> ye searched out<WH2713> what to say.<WH4405>
Yea, I attended<WH995> unto<WH5704> you, and, behold,<WH2009> there was none<WH369> of<WH4480> you that convinced<WH3198> Job,<WH347> or that answered<WH6030> his words: <WH561>
Lest <WH6435> ye should say,<WH559> We have found out<WH4672> wisdom:<WH2451> God<WH410> thrusteth him down,<WH5086> not<WH3808> man.<WH376>
Now he hath not<WH3808> directed<WH6186> his words<WH4405> against<WH413> me: neither<WH3808> will I answer<WH7725> him with your speeches.<WH561>
They were amazed,<WH2865> they answered<WH6030> no<WH3808> more:<WH5750> they left off<WH6275> <WH4480> speaking.<WH4405>
When I had waited,<WH3176> (for<WH3588> they spoke<WH1696> not,<WH3808> but<WH3588> stood still,<WH5975> and answered<WH6030> no<WH3808> more;)<WH5750>
I said, I<WH589> will answer<WH6030> also<WH637> my part,<WH2506> I<WH589> also<WH637> will show<WH2331> mine opinion.<WH1843>
For <WH3588> I am full<WH4390> of matter,<WH4405> the spirit<WH7307> within<WH990> me constraineth<WH6693> me.
Behold, <WH2009> my belly<WH990> is as wine<WH3196> which hath no<WH3808> vent;<WH6605> it is ready to burst<WH1234> like new<WH2319> bottles.<WH178>
I will speak,<WH1696> that I may be refreshed:<WH7304> I will open<WH6605> my lips<WH8193> and answer.<WH6030>
Let me not,<WH408> I pray you,<WH4994> accept<WH5375> any man's<WH376> person,<WH6440> neither<WH3808> let me give flattering titles<WH3655> unto<WH413> man.<WH120>
For <WH3588> I know<WH3045> not<WH3808> to give flattering titles;<WH3655> in so doing my maker<WH6213> would soon<WH4592> take me away.<WH5375>
